data.title: Which Hooters restaurants are closing? Full list of location closures revealed
data.meta_description: HOOTERS has gained itself a controversial reputation since opening up its first restaurant over four decades ago.The Atlanta-based sports bar chain is
data.text:
HOOTERS has gained itself a controversial reputation since opening up its first restaurant over four decades ago.

The Atlanta-based sports bar chain is infamous for its use of female servers in racy outfits but it has recently been forced to shut down a number of "under performing" stores - here's the full list of closures.

When are Hooters restaurants closing?

Hooters announced they were abruptly closing down a huge number of stores this week across the US.

Some of the restaurants had already been shut down prior to the official announcement.

Several more locked their doors for the final time over the weekend.

It is unclear on the exact timeline of when any more will close.

We look forward to continuing to serve our guests at home, on the go and at our restaurants here in the US and around the globe

Hooters spokesperson

The company has also been opening up a number of new locations across the US and internationally.

They have also focused a lot of time and cash into producing stay-at-home frozen goods for hungry shoppers.

The Hooters-branded frozen food has taken over grocery stores in the US in recent months.

A Hooters spokesperson told the New York Post: “We look forward to continuing to serve our guests at home, on the go and at our restaurants here in the US and around the globe."

Which Hooters restaurants are closing?

An exact figure hasn't been announced but reports say up to 45 stores have closed or are set to close in the coming weeks.

Hooters, who have over 300 stores worldwide, announced the US closures would take place in over 14 states.

These include Texas, Florida, North Carolina, Missouri and Georgia among others.

Several other states are also facing scrutiny from the Hooters' management looking to cut back on spending.

The full list of closures can be found below.

The number of Hooters have dropped by 12% since 2018, according to restaurant consulting firm Technomic.

Representatives from Hooters said the closures didn't reflect the chain's decline in quality or popularity.

They maintained the “brand of 41 years” is still “highly resilient and relevant”.

Why are some Hooters restaurants closing?

Hooters announced they are closing a range of “under performing stores” as inflation continues to batter the US with restaurants reportedly facing heavy losses.

The famous chain said “pressure from current market conditions” was behind the touch decision to close the unspecified number of stores.

The spokesperson added: “Like many restaurants under pressure from current market conditions, Hooters has made the difficult decision to close a select number of under performing stores.”

Inflation has rocked the restaurant industry in recent years with around one-third of all branded restaurant chains coming out of 2023 with less stores than they started with, according to National Restaurant News.

A recent survey by consultant group KPMG found that 41 per cent of consumers plan to spend less on restaurants this summer compared to last summer.

Just 21 per cent said they would spend more.

Duleep Rodridgo, KPMG’s US consumer and retail sector leader, said in the study: “Consumers are tightening their belts another notch as they hunt for discounts, and even some essentials are being impacted.

“We have already seen a few retailers lower prices, as they look to maintain the balance between their margins and demand.”
